name: hic-tad-analysis
title: Hi-C TAD Boundary & Loop Analysis
description: Focused Hi-C analysis for detecting TAD boundaries, chromatin loops, and CTCF/cohesin-mediated 3D structures. Identifies regulatory domain disruptions in disease.
content:
Hi-C TAD & Loop Analysis

Specialized analysis focusing on TADs (Topologically Associating Domains) and chromatin loops - the fundamental units of 3D genome organization that define regulatory domains and enable enhancer-promoter communication.

What are TADs?

TADs are genomic regions (100kb-1Mb) with high internal interaction frequency but low inter-TAD contacts. They form the basic structural units of chromosome folding.

Key Properties:

  • Size: Typically 100kb-1Mb (median ~880kb in human)
  • Conservation: Highly conserved across cell types (~70-90%)
  • Boundaries: Marked by CTCF, cohesin, housekeeping genes, tRNAs
  • Function: Regulatory domains - enhancers preferentially activate genes within same TAD

TAD Boundaries

What Defines TAD Boundaries?

  • CTCF: Insulator protein, binds ~50-100K sites
  • Cohesin: Ring complex (RAD21, SMC1, SMC3), extrudes chromatin loops
  • Convergent CTCF motifs: → ← orientation at loop anchors
  • Active Promoters: Transcriptionally active genes
  • tRNA Genes: Pol III-transcribed genes
  • Housekeeping Genes: Ubiquitously expressed

Boundary Strength:

  • Strong boundaries: CTCF + cohesin + active transcription
  • Weak boundaries: Single factor (less insulation)
  • Dynamic boundaries: Change during development/activation

Chromatin Loops

Types of Loops:

  • Structural Loops: CTCF-CTCF loops at TAD boundaries
  • Enhancer-Promoter Loops: Regulatory interactions (often Mediator/Cohesin-mediated)
  • Polycomb Loops: H3K27me3-marked repressive contacts
  • Super-Enhancer Loops: Dense regulatory hubs contacting key genes

Loop Extrusion Model:

  1. Cohesin loads onto chromatin
  2. Extrudes loop by pushing chromatin through ring
  3. Stops at CTCF (convergent motifs)
  4. Forms loop between two CTCF sites

Why TADs Matter for Biology

Regulatory Domains:

  • Enhancers in TAD-A activate genes in TAD-A (not TAD-B)
  • TAD boundaries insulate against inappropriate enhancer-gene contacts
  • Disruption → disease (enhancer hijacking)

Dosage-Sensitive Genes:

  • Developmental genes (HOX, SOX9, SHH) require precise expression
  • TAD integrity ensures proper enhancer wiring

TAD Disruption Mechanisms

Structural Variants Breaking TADs:

  • Deletions: Remove TAD boundary → fusion of adjacent TADs
  • Inversions: Flip genomic segment → alter enhancer-gene topology
  • Duplications: Create ectopic contacts
  • Translocations: Fuse TADs from different chromosomes

Disease Examples:

Limb Malformations:

  • Gene: EPHA4 (normally inactive in limb)
  • Mutation: Deletion removes TAD boundary upstream
  • Result: WNT6 enhancer (adjacent TAD) now contacts EPHA4
  • Outcome: Ectopic EPHA4 expression → F-syndrome (limb/rib defects)

Brain Disorders:

  • Gene: FOXG1 (forebrain development)
  • Mutation: Boundary deletion
  • Result: Inappropriate enhancer contacts → FOXG1 misexpression
  • Outcome: Rett-like syndrome

Cancer (Enhancer Hijacking):

  • Gene: TAL1 (oncogene in T-ALL)
  • Mutation: Deletion removes boundary
  • Result: TAL1 contacts MYB super-enhancer
  • Outcome: TAL1 overexpression → leukemia

Pipeline Focus

  1. High-Resolution TAD Calling: Identify domain boundaries at 40-100kb resolution
  2. Boundary Annotation: CTCF, cohesin, RNA Pol II ChIP-seq overlap
  3. Loop Detection: Significant focal interactions (HiCCUPS, HOMER)
  4. Boundary Strength: Insulation score quantification
  5. Differential TADs: Compare conditions (development, disease)
  6. Structural Variant Impact: Predict TAD disruption from SVs
  7. Virtual 4C: Interaction profile from candidate loci

Analysis Strategies

TAD Calling Algorithms:

  • Insulation Score: Local contact depletion at boundaries
  • Directionality Index: Asymmetry of contacts (upstream vs downstream)
  • Arrowhead: Detects corner peaks in contact matrices
  • TADbit: Statistical modeling of TAD structure

Boundary Strength Metrics:

  • Insulation score: Lower = stronger boundary
  • Boundary score: Sharpness of transition
  • Conservation: Presence across cell types/species

Scientific Questions

  • TAD Disruption: Do patient SVs break TAD boundaries?
  • Enhancer Wiring: Which enhancers contact which promoters within TADs?
  • Boundary Dynamics: How do TAD boundaries change during differentiation?
  • CTCF/Cohesin Depletion: What happens to TADs without cohesin?
  • Disease Prediction: Can we predict pathogenic SVs from TAD maps?
  • Evolutionary Conservation: Are TADs conserved across species?

Applications

Structural Variant Interpretation:

  • Clinical Genomics: Predict pathogenicity of deletions/inversions near developmental genes
  • Cancer Genomics: Identify enhancer hijacking events
  • Rare Disease: Explain non-coding mutations disrupting TADs

Functional Genomics:

  • CRISPR Screening: Validate TAD boundary elements
  • Enhancer Discovery: Link distal enhancers to target genes via loops
  • 3D Genome Editing: Engineer TAD boundaries

Drug Discovery:

  • Cohesin Inhibitors: Cancer therapy (cohesinopathies, AML)
  • Epigenetic Drugs: Alter 3D chromatin (BET inhibitors, HDAC inhibitors)

Experimental Design

Resolution Requirements:

  • TAD Calling: 40-100kb bins (100-500M reads)
  • Loop Detection: 5-10kb bins (1-5B reads)
  • Boundary Fine-Mapping: 1-5kb bins (>5B reads)

Recommended Depth:

  • TAD Discovery: 300-500M valid pairs
  • Loop Analysis: 1-2B valid pairs
  • High-Resolution: 5-10B valid pairs

Integration with Other Data

  • ChIP-seq: CTCF, cohesin, H3K27ac at boundaries and loops
  • RNA-seq: Gene expression changes correlate with TAD disruption
  • ATAC-seq: Open chromatin at TAD boundaries
  • Whole Genome Sequencing: Map SVs disrupting TADs

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet with columns:

  • sample: Sample name
  • fastq_1: Path to R1 FASTQ
  • fastq_2: Path to R2 FASTQ
  • replicate: Biological replicate

Key Outputs

  • TAD Boundaries: Genomic coordinates (BED)
  • Insulation Scores: Boundary strength (bedGraph)
  • Chromatin Loops: Loop anchors (BEDPE)
  • Loop Categories: CTCF, enhancer-promoter, Polycomb
  • Boundary Annotations: CTCF/cohesin overlap
  • Differential TADs: Condition-specific boundaries
  • Virtual 4C: Locus-specific contact profiles
  • Contact Matrices: Heatmaps at TAD resolution

Perfect for: TAD boundaries • Chromatin loops • Structural variant interpretation • Enhancer-gene wiring • Disease genomics • CTCF/cohesin
